name: potential
chn: n. 潜力;可能性 adj. 潜在的, 可能的
example_en: Every student has the potential to succeed.
example_cn: 每个学生都有成功的潜力。
word_family: potentially (adv. 可能地,潜在地)
memory_tips: 词根 'poten' 意为 'power'（力量），与 'potent'（强有力的）同源。有力量的，就是'有潜力的'。
collocations: unlock potential (释放潜力), potential customer (潜在客户), reach one's full potential (发挥全部潜力)
image_prompt: A diverse group of students in a bright classroom, each with a glowing light bulb icon above their head, symbolizing their potential.

synonym_diff.quick_guide: potential 指内在的、未被发掘的能力；possibility 指事情发生的可能性；capacity 指容纳或做事的能力。

details.focus: 强调客观上某事可能发生
details.example: There is a possibility of rain today.

details.focus: 强调容纳或完成某事的能力
details.example: The stadium has a seating capacity of 50,000.

name: senior
chn: adj. 中学的;级别高的;高级水平的;老年的 n. 级别（或地位）较高者;较…年长的人;高水平运动员
example_en: He is a senior manager in the company.
example_cn: 他是公司的一位高级经理。
word_family: seniority (n. 资历；年长)
memory_tips: 源自拉丁语 'senior'，意为 'older'（更年长的）。在等级、年龄上更'老'的就是'高级的'、'年长的'。
collocations: senior high school (高中), senior citizen (老年人), senior staff (高级职员)
image_prompt: A confident, well-dressed older man in a modern office, leading a meeting with younger colleagues, pointing at a presentation chart.

synonym_diff.quick_guide: senior 指年长的或级别高的，junior 指年幼的或级别低的。

details.focus: 与 senior 相对，指年幼、资历浅或级别低的人或事。
details.example: She is my junior by two years.

name: path
chn: n. 道路;小路;成功的途径
example_en: He followed the path through the forest.
example_cn: 他沿着小路穿过森林。
memory_tips: 联想 'pass'（通过），'path' 就是用来 'pass' 的路。
collocations: career path (职业道路), follow a path (沿着一条路走), the path to success (成功之路)
image_prompt: A person walking on a narrow, winding dirt path through a lush green forest, with sunlight filtering through the trees.

synonym_diff.quick_guide: path 是小路，road 是公路，street 是城镇街道，way 是泛指的路或方法。

details.focus: 连接城镇的公路，通常供车辆行驶
details.example: The main road into town is very busy.

details.focus: 城市或乡镇里两旁有建筑的街道
details.example: Let's take a walk down the street.

details.focus: 泛指路、路线、方向或方法
details.example: Can you show me the way to the station?

name: challenge
chn: n. & vt. 挑战;质疑
example_en: Climbing the mountain was a huge challenge.
example_cn: 攀登这座山是一个巨大的挑战。
word_family: challenging (adj. 挑战性的), challenger (n. 挑战者)
memory_tips: 想象一场激动人心的比赛 (challenge)，你需要全力以赴才能获胜。
collocations: face a challenge (面对挑战), accept a challenge (接受挑战), a big challenge (一个大挑战)
image_prompt: A determined hiker standing at the base of a tall, snowy mountain, looking up at the peak, ready for the climb.

synonym_diff.quick_guide: challenge 是需要努力克服的挑战(常含积极意味)；difficulty 是事情的困难度；obstacle 是前进路上的障碍物；problem 是需要解决的问题。

details.focus: 指某事的困难程度或状态
details.example: He had difficulty breathing.

details.focus: 指阻碍前进或达成目标的具体事物
details.example: Lack of funding is a major obstacle to the project.

details.focus: 指一个需要解决的、令人不快或困惑的情况
details.example: We need to find a solution to this problem.

name: thinking
chn: n. 思维,思想;想法
example_en: Critical thinking is an important skill.
example_cn: 批判性思维是一项重要技能。
word_family: think (v. 思考), thought (n. 想法), thinker (n. 思想家)
memory_tips: 动词 'think' 的现在分词形式，直接表示“思考”这个动作或过程。
collocations: critical thinking (批判性思维), positive thinking (积极思维), wishful thinking (一厢情愿的想法)
image_prompt: A silhouette of a person's head with glowing gears and connections inside, representing the process of thinking.

name: positive
chn: adj. 积极乐观的;良好的,正面的
example_en: She has a positive attitude towards life.
example_cn: 她对生活有积极的态度。
word_family: positively (adv. 积极地,肯定地), negativity (n. 消极性), negative (adj. 消极的)
memory_tips: 想象加号 '+'，它代表增加、好的方面，这就是 'positive'。
collocations: positive attitude (积极的态度), positive feedback (正面反馈), positive result (阳性结果/好结果)
image_prompt: A smiling young woman watering a thriving plant on a sunny balcony, symbolizing a positive and nurturing attitude.

synonym_diff.quick_guide: positive 是指态度或事物本身是积极的、建设性的；optimistic 侧重于对未来充满希望和信心。

details.focus: 对未来抱有希望和信心
details.example: He is optimistic about his chances of winning.

name: opportunity
chn: n. 机会,时机
example_en: This job is a great opportunity for me.
example_cn: 这份工作对我来说是个绝佳的机会。
memory_tips: 可以拆分为 'op' (toward) + 'port' (港口)，想象一艘船驶向港口，这是一个靠岸的“时机”。
collocations: seize the opportunity (抓住机会), miss an opportunity (错过机会), a golden opportunity (黄金机会)
image_prompt: A person standing before an open door, with bright light and a beautiful landscape visible through it, symbolizing a great opportunity.

synonym_diff.quick_guide: opportunity 比较正式，通常指做某事的有利时机；chance 更口语化，常带有偶然、运气的意味。

details.focus: 通常指偶然或意外获得的机会，或可能性
details.example: I met her by chance.

name: lie in
chn: 存在于,在于
example_en: The problem lies in our lack of communication.
example_cn: 问题在于我们缺乏沟通。
memory_tips: 'lie' 有“位于”的意思，'in' 表示“在…里面”。“位于…里面”，引申为“存在于，在于”。
collocations: the difficulty lies in (困难在于), the secret lies in (秘诀在于), the difference lies in (区别在于)
image_prompt: Two people sitting back to back, looking angry, with a tangled, knotted rope between them, symbolizing a communication problem.

name: rise to
chn: 能够处理
example_en: She will rise to the challenge and succeed.
example_cn: 她将能应对挑战并取得成功。
memory_tips: 'rise' 是上升，'to' 是到某个高度。上升到某个高度，引申为“能够胜任、处理”。
collocations: rise to the challenge (迎接挑战), rise to the occasion (临场发挥出色)
image_prompt: A person successfully climbing over a large obstacle wall, with a look of determination and achievement, symbolizing rising to a challenge.

name: acquire
chn: vt. 获得,得到
example_en: He acquired the skills needed for the job.
example_cn: 他获得了这项工作所需的技能。
word_family: acquisition (n. 获得物, 获得)
memory_tips: ac-(加强) + quire(寻求)，不断寻求，最终“获得”。
collocations: acquire knowledge (获取知识), acquire a reputation (获得声誉), acquire a company (收购一家公司)
image_prompt: A person diligently reading a book, with icons of various skills (like coding, languages, design) flowing from the book into their head.

synonym_diff.quick_guide: acquire 较正式，常指通过努力获得知识、技能或财产；get 最常用；obtain 较正式，指通过请求或努力得到；gain 指获得有益的东西。

details.focus: 最常用、最口语化的“得到”
details.example: I need to get some milk.

details.focus: 比get正式，常指通过努力或请求获得
details.example: You can obtain the documents from the office.

details.focus: 通常指获得有益或有价值的东西，如经验、体重
details.example: She gained a lot of experience working there.

name: effort
chn: n. 努力,费力的事;试图
example_en: It takes a lot of effort to learn a new language.
example_cn: 学习一门新语言需要付出很多努力。
word_family: effortless (adj. 不费力气的)
memory_tips: 可以看作 'ef-' (out) + 'fort' (strong)，使出力量，即“努力”。
collocations: make an effort (努力), joint effort (共同努力), with great effort (非常努力地)
image_prompt: A person sweating while pushing a large, heavy boulder up a hill, showing immense effort and determination.

name: advance
chn: n. 进步,进展;前进,行进 vt. & vi. 发展,进步
example_en: Technology has advanced rapidly in recent years.
example_cn: 近年来技术进步飞速。
word_family: advanced (adj. 高级的;先进的), advancement (n. 发展, 进步)
memory_tips: 'ad-' (to, forward) + 'vance' (来自法语 avant, 'before')，向前走，即“前进，进步”。
collocations: in advance (提前), technological advance (技术进步), advance one's career (发展事业)
image_prompt: A timeline graphic showing technology evolving from an old computer to a futuristic holographic interface, with an arrow pointing forward labeled 'Advance'.

synonym_diff.quick_guide: advance 强调向前移动或达到更高水平；progress 侧重于朝着目标稳步前进的过程；develop 侧重于从无到有或从小到大的发展、成长。

details.focus: 指朝着一个目标持续地前进或改进
details.example: The construction work is making good progress.

details.focus: 指事物逐渐成长、扩大或变得更成熟复杂
details.example: The city has developed into a major financial center.

name: amazing
chn: adj. 令人大为惊奇的,令人惊喜的
example_en: The view from the top of the mountain is amazing.
example_cn: 从山顶看去的景色美得惊人。
word_family: amaze (vt. 使吃惊), amazed (adj. （人）吃惊的), amazement (n. 惊异;惊愕)
memory_tips: a- + maze (迷宫)，进入一个迷宫，感到“令人惊奇”。
collocations: amazing view (壮丽的景色), amazing story (惊人的故事), absolutely amazing (绝对惊人)
image_prompt: A person standing on a mountain peak at sunrise, arms outstretched, looking at a breathtaking panoramic view of clouds and distant mountains.

name: confidence
chn: n. 信心,信任;把握
example_en: She spoke with confidence during the presentation.
example_cn: 她在演讲时充满自信。
word_family: confident (adj. 自信的), confidently (adv. 自信地)
memory_tips: 'con-' (加强) + 'fid' (trust, faith) + '-ence' (名词后缀)。完全的信任，即“信心”。
collocations: have confidence in (对...有信心), lack confidence (缺乏信心), boost confidence (增强信心)
image_prompt: A woman in a business suit standing on a stage, smiling and speaking confidently to a large audience.

name: make a difference
chn: 起作用,有影响
example_en: Volunteering can make a difference in the community.
example_cn: 做志愿者可以对社区产生影响。
word_family: difference (n. 差异), differ (v. 不同), different (adj. 不同的)
memory_tips: 字面意思是“制造一个不同”，即通过行动带来改变，从而“起作用，有影响”。
collocations: make a big difference (产生巨大影响), make a real difference (产生真正的影响)
image_prompt: A group of diverse volunteers happily planting trees in a city park, transforming a barren area into a green space.

name: make the most of
chn: 充分利用,尽情享受
example_en: Let's make the most of the sunny weather and go to the beach.
example_cn: 我们充分利用这晴朗的天气去海滩吧。
memory_tips: 字面意思是“把...制造成最多的”，即最大化地使用某物，也就是“充分利用”。
collocations: make the most of an opportunity (充分利用机会), make the most of your time (充分利用你的时间)
image_prompt: A group of friends laughing and playing volleyball on a sunny beach, enjoying the beautiful day to the fullest.

name: resource
chn: n. 资源;资料;谋略
example_en: The library is a great resource for students.
example_cn: 图书馆对学生来说是很好的资源。
word_family: source (n. 来源,出处), resourceful (adj. 足智多谋的)
memory_tips: re- (again) + source (源头)。可以再次使用的源头，就是“资源”。
collocations: natural resources (自然资源), online resources (网络资源), human resources (人力资源)
image_prompt: A student sitting in a modern, well-lit library, surrounded by books, using a laptop, with icons for data and information floating around.

name: take advantage of
chn: 利用
example_en: You should take advantage of this opportunity to travel.
example_cn: 你应该利用这次机会去旅行。
word_family: advantage (n. 优势), disadvantage (n. 劣势)
memory_tips: 字面意思是“取得...的优势”，也就是“利用”。注意，这个短语有时带贬义，意为“占便宜”。
collocations: take full advantage of (充分利用), take advantage of someone's kindness (利用某人的善良)
image_prompt: A student eagerly signing up for a study abroad program at a university fair, seizing an opportunity.

name: facility
chn: n. 设施,设备;场所
example_en: The hotel has excellent sports facilities.
example_cn: 这家酒店有极好的体育设施。
word_family: facilitate (v. 促进, 使便利)
memory_tips: 词根 'fac' 意为 'make, do'（做）。让事情做起来更容易的东西，就是“设施、设备”。
collocations: sports facilities (体育设施), medical facilities (医疗设施), production facility (生产设施)
image_prompt: A wide-angle shot of a modern sports complex, showing a swimming pool, tennis courts, and a gym.

synonym_diff.quick_guide: facility 指大型的场所或设施；equipment 指具体的工具或设备；amenity 指提升舒适便利的设施（如酒店的游泳池）。

details.focus: 指为特定目的而配备的工具、器械
details.example: The photographer has a lot of expensive equipment.

details.focus: 指使生活更舒适方便的设施，尤指酒店、住宅区的配套设施
details.example: The hotel amenities include a gym and a sauna.

name: equal
chn: adj. 相等的;平等的 n. 同等的人（物）linking v. 与…相等vt. 比得上
example_en: All people should have equal rights.
example_cn: 所有人都应享有平等的权利。
word_family: equally (adv. 平等地;同样地), equality (n. 平等), inequality (n. 不平等)
memory_tips: 发音类似“依靠”，大家互相依靠，地位是“平等的”。
collocations: equal rights (平等权利), equal opportunity (平等机会), be equal to (等于)
image_prompt: A diverse group of people of different races, genders, and ages standing together holding hands in a line, with a balance scale symbol above them.

name: attitude
chn: n. attitude /ˈætɪtjuːd/ n. 态度,看法
example_en: A positive attitude will help you succeed.
example_cn: 积极的态度会帮助你成功。
memory_tips: 联想 'altitude' (高度)，你的'attitude' (态度)决定了你的 'altitude' (人生高度)。
collocations: a positive attitude (积极的态度), a bad attitude (恶劣的态度), attitude towards (对...的态度)
image_prompt: Two figures climbing a mountain. One has a smiley face icon and is climbing easily, the other has a frowny face icon and is struggling. This illustrates the effect of attitude.

name: goal
chn: n. 目标;进球得分
example_en: My main goal is to finish the project on time.
example_cn: 我的主要目标是按时完成这个项目。
memory_tips: 发音像“够”，你需要努力才能够得着的东西，就是你的“目标”。
collocations: set a goal (设定目标), achieve a goal (实现目标), score a goal (进球得分)
image_prompt: A person drawing a large target on a whiteboard, with a clear path of steps leading to the bullseye, which is labeled 'Goal'.

synonym_diff.quick_guide: goal 是长期、宏大的目标；aim 是努力的方向或意图；objective 是具体的、可衡量的短期目标；target 是最具体、精确的目标。

details.focus: 意图或努力的大方向
details.example: Our aim is to provide the best service.

details.focus: 为实现 goal 而设定的具体、可衡量的步骤
details.example: Our main objective this year is to increase sales by 10%.

details.focus: 一个非常具体、需要精确达到的点或数字
details.example: The sales target for this month is $50,000.

name: balance
chn: vt.同等重视;（使）保持平衡; 权衡重要性 n.均衡,平衡;平衡能力
example_en: It's important to find a balance between work and life.
example_cn: 在工作和生活之间找到平衡很重要。
word_family: balanced (adj. 平衡的), imbalance (n. 不平衡)
memory_tips: 想象一个天平（balance），两边放着东西，保持“平衡”。
collocations: work-life balance (工作与生活的平衡), keep your balance (保持平衡), a sense of balance (平衡感)
image_prompt: A modern graphic of a scale, with a laptop and documents on one side, and a heart, family, and hobbies on the other side, perfectly balanced.

name: improve
chn: vt. & vi. 改进,改善
example_en: I want to improve my English speaking skills.
example_cn: 我想提高我的英语口语能力。
word_family: improvement (n. 改善,提高)
memory_tips: im- (in) + prove (证实)。向内证实自己的能力，不断“改进，改善”。
collocations: improve skills (提高技能), improve the situation (改善状况), room for improvement (有改进的空间)
image_prompt: A graph showing a line moving steadily upwards, with labels like 'Before' at the bottom and 'After' at the top, illustrating improvement.

synonym_diff.quick_guide: improve 是最普通的“改善”；enhance 强调在好的基础上“增强、提升”价值或品质；better 是 improve 的一个较不正式的同义词；upgrade 是指“升级”到更高版本或规格。

details.focus: 提升某物的品质、价值或吸引力
details.example: The new lighting will enhance the beauty of the painting.

details.focus: 作为动词，意为“改善”，常用于改善自身或某状况
details.example: He went to night school to better himself.

details.focus: 指将某物升级到更好的标准或版本
details.example: We need to upgrade our computer system.

name: last but not least
chn: 最后但同样重要的
example_en: Last but not least, I'd like to thank my family for their support.
example_cn: 最后但同样重要的是，我要感谢我的家人的支持。
memory_tips: 字面意思就是“最后一个，但不是最不重要的一个”，用于引出清单中的最后一项，并强调其重要性。
image_prompt: A speaker on stage at the end of a speech, gesturing warmly towards their family sitting in the front row of the audience.

name: well-rounded
chn: adj. 全面发展的;面面俱到的
example_en: The school aims to produce well-rounded individuals.
example_cn: 这所学校旨在培养全面发展的个人。
memory_tips: well (好) + rounded (圆形的)。一个很“圆”的人，没有棱角，各方面都很均衡，即“全面发展的”。
collocations: a well-rounded education (全面发展的教育), a well-rounded person (一个全面发展的人)
image_prompt: A person's silhouette with different icons inside representing various skills and hobbies: sports, music, science, art. This shows a well-rounded personality.

name: individual
chn: n. 个人adj. 单独的,个别的
example_en: Each individual has a unique set of skills.
example_cn: 每个人都有一套独特的技能。
word_family: individually (adv. 分别地;各自地), individuality (n. 个性)
memory_tips: in- (not) + divide (分开)。不能再分开的最小单位，就是“个人”。
collocations: individual needs (个人需求), individual attention (个人关注), a creative individual (一个有创造力的人)
image_prompt: A large crowd of grey, uniform figures, with one colorful, unique individual standing out from the rest.

name: character
chn: n. 品质,性格;特点;人物,角色;文字
example_en: Honesty is an important part of a person's character.
example_cn: 诚实是一个人品格的重要组成部分。
word_family: characterize (vt. 描述……的特性), characteristic (n. 特征;特色)
memory_tips: 联想电影或书中的 'character' (角色)，每个角色都有独特的“性格”和“品质”。
collocations: a person of good character (品格好的人), main character (主角), Chinese character (汉字)
image_prompt: A symbolic image showing a person's silhouette filled with words like 'Honesty', 'Courage', 'Kindness', representing their character.

synonym_diff.quick_guide: character 指道德品质；personality 指外在表现出的性格；nature 指天生的性情；trait 指具体的性格特点。

details.focus: 一个人与他人互动时表现出的整体性格特征
details.example: She has a very warm and friendly personality.

details.focus: 一个人与生俱来的、最根本的性情
details.example: It's not in his nature to be cruel.

details.focus: 指某个具体的性格特点
details.example: Patience is one of her best traits.

name: responsible
chn: adj. 有责任,负责;可靠的
example_en: You are responsible for your own actions.
example_cn: 你要为自己的行为负责。
word_family: responsibly (adv. 负责地), responsibility (n. 责任;义务)
memory_tips: 来自 'respond' (回应)，能够对自己的行为或职责做出回应的，就是“负责的”。
collocations: be responsible for (对...负责), a responsible person (一个有责任心的人), socially responsible (有社会责任感的)
image_prompt: A person carefully holding a fragile seedling in their hands, symbolizing care and responsibility for something delicate.

synonym_diff.quick_guide: responsible 指有责任去做某事；accountable 指在事情发生后，需要对结果负责并接受评判或惩罚。

details.focus: 强调对后果的责任，必须做出解释
details.example: The government should be accountable to the people.

name: ahead
chn: adv.（时间、空间）向前;提前
example_en: He walked ahead of us.
example_cn: 他走在我们前面。
memory_tips: a + head，用头（head）朝着的方向，就是“向前”。
collocations: go ahead (继续, 前进), look ahead (向前看), plan ahead (提前计划)
image_prompt: A runner on a track, clearly in the lead and far ahead of the other runners behind her.

name: junior
chn: adj.（ 学校）为 11 或 13 岁以下儿童设立的;地位（或级别）低的;青少年的n. 职位较低者;青少年运动员
example_en: He is a junior employee at the company.
example_cn: 他是公司的初级员工。
memory_tips: 来自拉丁语 'junior'，意为 'younger' (更年轻的)。与 senior (年长的，高级的) 相对。
collocations: junior high school (初中), junior staff (初级员工), ten years my junior (比我小十岁)
image_prompt: A young, enthusiastic office worker sitting at a desk, learning from a more experienced colleague who is pointing at the computer screen.

synonym_diff.quick_guide: junior 指年幼的或级别低的，senior 指年长的或级别高的。

details.focus: 与 junior 相对，指年长、资历深或级别高的人或事。
details.example: She is a senior partner at the law firm.

name: forward
chn: adv. 向将来;向前;进展
example_en: She took a step forward.
example_cn: 她向前迈了一步。
memory_tips: 'fore' (前面) + '-ward' (方向)。向着前面的方向，即“向前”。
collocations: look forward to (盼望), move forward (前进), step forward (向前一步)
image_prompt: A simple animation of an arrow pointing to the right, with the word 'FORWARD' written below it, symbolizing progress and moving ahead.

name: look forward to
chn: 盼望,期待
example_en: I look forward to seeing you soon.
example_cn: 我期待很快能见到你。
memory_tips: 'look' (看) + 'forward' (向前)。向前看，表示对未来的“期待、盼望”。注意 to 是介词，后面要跟名词或动名词（-ing形式）。
collocations: look forward to hearing from you (期待你的回信), look forward to the holiday (盼望假期)
image_prompt: A person looking at a calendar, with a future date circled with a heart, and a happy, expectant expression on their face.

name: independent
chn: adj. 自主的,有主见的;自立的
example_en: She is a very independent young woman.
example_cn: 她是一位非常独立的年轻女性。
word_family: independence (n. 独立), independently (adv. 独立地), dependent (adj. 依赖的)
memory_tips: in- (not) + dependent (依赖的)。不依赖别人的，就是“独立的”。
collocations: independent thinking (独立思考), financially independent (经济独立), an independent country (独立的国家)
image_prompt: A young woman successfully assembling a piece of furniture by herself using a manual, looking proud and capable.

name: focus
chn: n. 焦点vt. & vi. 集中
example_en: Please focus on your work.
example_cn: 请集中精力工作。
memory_tips: 联想照相机的 'focus' (对焦)，把所有注意力都像镜头一样对准一个点，就是“集中”。
collocations: focus on (集中于), the main focus (主要焦点), in focus (清晰的)
image_prompt: A camera lens zooming in on a single flower in a field, making the flower sharp and clear (in focus) while the background is blurry.

synonym_diff.quick_guide: focus 和 concentrate 几乎可以互换，都表示“集中精力”。focus 更常用于比喻义，指“关注的焦点”，而 concentrate 更强调精神上的努力。

details.focus: 强调付出精神努力来关注某事
details.example: I can't concentrate with all that noise.

name: detail
chn: n. 细节;具体情况
example_en: The devil is in the details.
example_cn: 魔鬼在细节中。（意指细节很重要）
word_family: detailed (adj. 详细的)
memory_tips: de- (down) + tail (切)。切分到最细小的部分，就是“细节”。
collocations: in detail (详细地), pay attention to detail (注意细节), minor detail (次要细节)
image_prompt: A magnifying glass hovering over a complex blueprint, highlighting a small but crucial part of the design.

name: as a result of
chn: 由于
example_en: He was late as a result of the traffic jam.
example_cn: 由于交通堵塞，他迟到了。
word_family: result (n. 结果)
memory_tips: 字面意思是“作为...的结果”，用来引出原因，相当于 'because of'。
image_prompt: A long line of cars stuck in a traffic jam on a highway, with a person in one car looking stressed and pointing at their watch.

name: tip
chn: n. 指点,实用的提示;尖端;小费
example_en: He gave me a useful tip for learning vocabulary.
example_cn: 他给了我一个记单词的有用提示。
memory_tips: 联想 'tip of the iceberg' (冰山一角)，'tip' 是尖端，引申为精炼的、关键的“指点，提示”。
collocations: a useful tip (有用的提示), give a tip (给小费), the tip of the pencil (铅笔尖)
image_prompt: A hand handing a glowing lightbulb to another person, symbolizing the sharing of a bright idea or a useful tip.

synonym_diff.quick_guide: tip 是具体、实用的小窍门；advice 是比较正式的建议；suggestion 是提出的想法供人考虑；hint 是间接的、暗示性的提示。

details.focus: 通常是基于知识或经验给出的指导性意见（不可数）
details.example: Can you give me some advice?

details.focus: 提出的一个想法或计划供他人考虑
details.example: I have a suggestion: let's go out for dinner.

details.focus: 间接的、不明确的提示
details.example: He dropped a hint that he wanted a new watch for his birthday.

name: base
chn: vt.以…为基础（依据）n.根据;基础;基底;总部,大本营
example_en: The movie is based on a true story.
example_cn: 这部电影是根据一个真实的故事改编的。
word_family: basic (adj. 基本的), basically (adv. 基本上)
memory_tips: 想象建筑物的 'base' (地基)，所有的东西都建立在它之上，所以它可以作为动词“以...为基础”。
collocations: be based on (基于), military base (军事基地), customer base (客户基础)
image_prompt: An open book with the words 'True Story' on its pages, and filmstrips rising from the book to form a movie screen.

name: remind
chn: vt. 提醒,使想起
example_en: Please remind me to call him tomorrow.
example_cn: 请提醒我明天给他打电话。
word_family: reminder (n. 提醒物)
memory_tips: re- (again) + mind (头脑)。让信息再次进入你的头脑，就是“提醒”。
collocations: remind someone to do something (提醒某人做某事), remind someone of something (让某人想起某事)
image_prompt: A sticky note with 'Call Mom!' written on it, stuck to a computer monitor.

name: stick to
chn: 坚持; 遵守,维持
example_en: You must stick to your principles.
example_cn: 你必须坚持你的原则。
word_family: stick (v. 粘贴), sticker (n. 贴纸)
memory_tips: 'stick' 的本意是“粘贴”，像胶水一样粘在一个东西上不放，引申为“坚持”。
collocations: stick to the plan (坚持计划), stick to the rules (遵守规则), stick to a diet (坚持节食)
image_prompt: A person holding firmly onto a sign that says 'My Plan', while wind and rain try to push them away, symbolizing sticking to the plan.

synonym_diff.quick_guide: stick to 强调遵守计划或原则；insist on 强调坚决主张或要求；persist in 强调不顾困难或反对而持续做某事。

details.focus: 坚决要求或主张，常用于表达观点
details.example: He insisted on paying for the meal.

details.focus: 不顾困难或反对等负面因素，固执地继续做某事
details.example: She persisted in her studies despite her illness.

name: proposal
chn: n. 提议,建议,动议
example_en: He made a proposal to improve the company's workflow.
example_cn: 他提出了一项改善公司工作流程的建议。
word_family: propose (vt. 建议;求婚)
memory_tips: 来自 'propose' (提议)，其名词形式。pro-(向前) + pose(放)，把想法放到大家面前，就是“提议”。
collocations: make a proposal (提出建议), a business proposal (商业提案), a marriage proposal (求婚)
image_prompt: A person presenting a document titled 'Improvement Proposal' to a group of colleagues in a meeting room.

name: aim
chn: n. 目的,目标 vi. & vt.力争做到; 目的是;针对
example_en: The main aim of the project is to help the poor.
example_cn: 这个项目的主要目的是帮助穷人。
word_family: aimless (adj. 无目标的)
memory_tips: 想象射箭时 'aim' (瞄准)靶心，这就是你的“目标”。
collocations: aim at (瞄准, 旨在), with the aim of (目的在于), the long-term aim (长期目标)
image_prompt: An archer carefully aiming an arrow at the center of a distant target.

synonym_diff.quick_guide: aim 是努力的方向或意图；goal 是长期、宏大的目标；objective 是具体的、可衡量的短期目标；target 是最具体、精确的目标。

details.focus: 一个长期的、更宏大的最终目的
details.example: My goal in life is to be happy.

details.focus: 为实现 goal 而设定的具体、可衡量的步骤
details.example: Our immediate objective is to finish this report.

details.focus: 一个非常具体、需要精确达到的点或数字
details.example: The sales target for this quarter is 1 million dollars.

name: style
chn: n. 风格;方式;样式
example_en: I like her style of writing.
example_cn: 我喜欢她的写作风格。
word_family: stylish (adj. 时髦的, 有格调的)
memory_tips: 发音像“死呆哦”，一种独特的、不会死的呆法，就是一种“风格”。
collocations: in style (时髦), lifestyle (生活方式), leadership style (领导风格)
image_prompt: A montage of different writing styles: one is ornate and calligraphic, one is modern and minimalist, and one is bold and graphic.

name: technique
chn: n. 技巧,技艺;技能
example_en: The artist has a unique painting technique.
example_cn: 这位艺术家有独特的绘画技巧。
word_family: technical (adj. 技术的)
memory_tips: 来自 'techno-' (技术，艺术)，与 technology 同源。指完成某项任务的具体“技术、技巧”。
collocations: a new technique (一项新技术), breathing technique (呼吸技巧), require technique (需要技巧)
image_prompt: A close-up shot of a chef's hands skillfully and precisely slicing vegetables with a large knife.

synonym_diff.quick_guide: technique 是做某事的具体方法或技巧；skill 是通过学习和练习掌握的能力；method 是做事的系统性方法或程序。

details.focus: 指经过练习而获得的做某事的能力
details.example: Communication is a very important skill.

details.focus: 指做某事的系统性的程序或方式
details.example: We need to find a more effective method of teaching.

name: workshop
chn: n. 研讨会,讲习班;车间,作坊
example_en: I'm attending a photography workshop this weekend.
example_cn: 我这周末要参加一个摄影研讨会。
memory_tips: work + shop。既可以指工作的“车间”，也可以指大家一起“工作”和学习的“研讨会”。
collocations: attend a workshop (参加研讨会), a creative writing workshop (创意写作研讨会), a carpenter's workshop (木工房)
image_prompt: A small group of people gathered around a table with their cameras, listening intently as a professional photographer gives them instructions.

name: professional
chn: adj. 职业的;有职业的;娴熟的,精通业务的 n. 专门人员,专业人士
example_en: He is a professional photographer.
example_cn: 他是一名职业摄影师。
word_family: profession (n. 职业), professor (n. 教授)
memory_tips: 来自 'profession' (职业)，指以某个行业为生，并具备高水平技能的人。
collocations: professional advice (专业建议), professional athlete (职业运动员), look professional (看起来很专业)
image_prompt: A photographer with professional camera gear, skillfully taking photos of a model in a studio setting.

name: material
chn: n. 材料;素材 adj. 物质的,实际的;客观存在的
example_en: We need to buy some materials to build the model.
example_cn: 我们需要买些材料来做这个模型。
word_family: materialism (n. 物质主义), materialize (v. 实现, 出现)
memory_tips: 词根 'mater' 意为 'mother' (母亲)，引申为万物的根源、物质。“母亲”是孕育生命的基础“材料”。
collocations: raw material (原材料), building materials (建筑材料), teaching material (教学材料)
image_prompt: A workbench with various materials laid out: wood, fabric, metal, and plastic, ready for a project.

name: poster
chn: n. 海报;（在网络留言板上）发布消息的人
example_en: She designed a poster for the school concert.
example_cn: 她为学校音乐会设计了一张海报。
word_family: post (v. 张贴, 发布; n. 帖子)
memory_tips: 来自 'post' (张贴)，用来张贴的东西，就是“海报”。
collocations: put up a poster (张贴海报), a movie poster (电影海报), a poster campaign (海报宣传活动)
image_prompt: A person pinning a colorful, eye-catching poster for a music festival onto a public bulletin board.

name: secondary
chn: adj.中学的;次要的
example_en: This is a matter of secondary importance.
example_cn: 这是一件次要的事情。
word_family: second (num. 第二)
memory_tips: 来自 'second' (第二)，排在第二位的，就是“次要的”。中学教育 (secondary education) 是在小学 (primary) 之后的第二阶段。
collocations: secondary school (中学), secondary effect (次要影响), secondary role (次要角色)
image_prompt: A pie chart where one large slice is labeled 'Primary Goal' and a much smaller slice is labeled 'Secondary Importance'.

name: exchange
chn: n. & vt. 交换;交流;兑换
example_en: They met to exchange ideas.
example_cn: 他们见面交流想法。
memory_tips: ex- (out) + change (改变，交换)。把你的东西拿出来，和别人的“交换”。
collocations: in exchange for (作为...的交换), exchange rate (汇率), cultural exchange (文化交流)
image_prompt: Two people sitting opposite each other, with thought bubbles above their heads containing different ideas, and arrows showing the ideas being exchanged between them.

name: host
chn: n. 主人;东道主;主持人 vt. 主办;主持
example_en: Our country will host the next Olympic Games.
example_cn: 我国将主办下一届奥运会。
word_family: hostess (n. 女主人)
memory_tips: 联想 'guest' (客人)，'host' 就是招待 'guest' 的“主人”。
collocations: host a party (举办派对), talk show host (脱口秀主持人), host family (寄宿家庭)
image_prompt: A smiling person on a stage with a microphone, gesturing towards the audience, in the role of a host.

name: a.m.
chn: 上午,午前
example_en: The meeting is at 10 a.m.
example_cn: 会议在上午10点。
memory_tips: 拉丁语 'ante meridiem' 的缩写，ante 意为 'before' (之前)，meridiem 意为 'midday' (中午)。合起来就是“中午之前”。
image_prompt: A clock face showing the time as 10:00, with the sun rising in the background.

name: p.m.
chn: 下午,午后
example_en: The movie starts at 7 p.m.
example_cn: 电影晚上7点开始。
memory_tips: 拉丁语 'post meridiem' 的缩写，post 意为 'after' (之后)，meridiem 意为 'midday' (中午)。合起来就是“中午之后”。
image_prompt: A clock face showing the time as 7:00, with the moon and stars in the background.

name: biology
chn: n. 生物学
example_en: Biology is the study of living things.
example_cn: 生物学是研究生物的科学。
word_family: biologist (n. 生物学家), biological (adj. 生物的)
memory_tips: bio- (生命) + -logy (学科)。研究生命的学科，就是“生物学”。
collocations: biology class (生物课), marine biology (海洋生物学), molecular biology (分子生物学)
image_prompt: A microscope on a lab table, next to a petri dish with cells, and illustrations of plants, animals, and DNA strands in the background.

name: tough
chn: adj. 艰难的;严厉的;坚强的;坚固的
example_en: It was a tough decision to make.
example_cn: 这是一个艰难的决定。
word_family: toughly (adv. 艰难地), toughness (n. 坚韧)
memory_tips: 发音像“塔夫”，一个能建起高塔的工人，一定是“强壮的”，做的事情也是“艰难的”。
collocations: a tough guy (硬汉), a tough question (难题), get tough with (对...采取强硬态度)
image_prompt: A person at a crossroads, with two paths leading into foggy, uncertain territory, looking thoughtful and serious, indicating a tough decision.

synonym_diff.quick_guide: 这三个词意思相近。hard 是最常用的“困难的”；difficult 比 hard 更正式一点；tough 含有“棘手的、严酷的”意思，强调挑战性大。

details.focus: 最口语化和最常用的词，指需要努力才能完成的
details.example: This math problem is very hard.

details.focus: 比 hard 正式，强调事情复杂，需要技巧或知识
details.example: It's a difficult situation.

name: alarm
chn: n. 闹钟;恐慌;警报;警报器vt. 使惊恐,使害怕
example_en: My alarm clock rings at 6 every morning.
example_cn: 我的闹钟每天早上6点响。
word_family: alarming (adj. 令人担忧的)
memory_tips: 联想 'all arm' (全副武装)，军队全副武装准备战斗，是因为收到了“警报”，会让人“惊恐”。
collocations: alarm clock (闹钟), fire alarm (火警), raise the alarm (拉响警报)
image_prompt: A classic alarm clock with two bells on top, ringing loudly with vibration lines coming off it, next to a bed.

name: contribution
chn: n. 贡献;捐款;捐赠
example_en: He made a significant contribution to science.
example_cn: 他对科学做出了重大贡献。
word_family: contribute (v. 贡献), contributor (n. 贡献者)
memory_tips: 来自 'contribute'。con-(共同) + tribute(给予)，大家一起给予，就是“贡献”。
collocations: make a contribution (做出贡献), a valuable contribution (宝贵的贡献), contribution to society (对社会的贡献)
image_prompt: A statue of a famous scientist, with people laying flowers at its base to honor their great contribution.

name: fortunately
chn: adv. 幸运地,幸亏
example_en: Fortunately, no one was injured in the accident.
example_cn: 幸运的是，没有人在事故中受伤。
word_family: fortunate (adj. 幸运的), unfortunate (adj. 不幸的), unfortunately (adv. 不幸地), fortune (n. 运气;财富)
memory_tips: 来自 'fortune' (运气)，加上 -ate 和 -ly 构成形容词和副词。有好运气地，就是“幸运地”。
image_prompt: A car that has skidded to a stop just inches from a tree, with the driver inside looking relieved. The scene is safe, highlighting the fortune.

name: over time
chn: 随着时间流逝,久而久之
example_en: Your skills will improve over time.
example_cn: 你的技能会随着时间的推移而提高。
memory_tips: 字面意思就是“跨越时间”，用来描述一个逐渐发生的过程。
image_prompt: A sequence of four images showing a small sapling growing progressively into a large, strong tree, illustrating change over time.

name: option
chn: n. 可选择的事物;选修课
example_en: You have two options: stay or leave.
example_cn: 你有两个选择：留下或离开。
word_family: optional (adj. 可选择的,非强制的)
memory_tips: 来自 'opt' (选择)，'option' 就是可供选择的东西。
collocations: have no option but to (别无选择只能), keep your options open (保留选择余地), the best option (最佳选择)
image_prompt: A person standing in front of two doors, one labeled 'Stay' and the other 'Leave', representing a choice or option.

synonym_diff.quick_guide: option 和 choice 很接近，option 强调可供选择的项目，choice 强调选择这个动作或结果。alternative 指两者或多者择一的另一个选择。

details.focus: 指选择的权利、行为或结果
details.example: It's your choice.

details.focus: 指（尤指在已有选项之外的）另一个可供选择的东西
details.example: If the bus is late, the only alternative is to take a taxi.

name: butter
chn: n. 黄油
example_en: I like to spread butter on my toast.
example_cn: 我喜欢在吐司上抹黄油。
memory_tips: 发音像“爸特”，爸爸特别爱吃的东西——“黄油”。
collocations: bread and butter (黄油面包, 谋生之道), butter a pan (在平底锅上抹黄油)
image_prompt: A close-up shot of a knife spreading soft, yellow butter onto a piece of crispy, golden-brown toast.

name: pudding
chn: n. 甜点;布丁
example_en: We had chocolate pudding for dessert.
example_cn: 我们吃了巧克力布丁当甜点。
memory_tips: 发音像“布丁”，直接音译记忆。
collocations: rice pudding (米布丁), Christmas pudding (圣诞布丁), the proof of the pudding is in the eating (实践出真知)
image_prompt: A delicious-looking chocolate pudding in a glass cup, topped with whipped cream and a cherry.

name: attract
chn: vt. 吸引,使喜爱;招引;引起（反应）
example_en: The beautiful flowers attract many bees.
example_cn: 美丽的花朵吸引了许多蜜蜂。
word_family: attractive (adj. 吸引人的), attraction (n. 吸引力;景点)
memory_tips: at- (to) + tract (draw, pull)。拉向自己，即“吸引”。
collocations: attract attention (吸引注意), attract tourists (吸引游客), attract investment (吸引投资)
image_prompt: A vibrant, colorful flower in a garden with several bees buzzing around it, drawn to its nectar.

name: rugby
chn: n. 橄榄球运动
example_en: He plays rugby for his school team.
example_cn: 他为校队打橄榄球。
memory_tips: 起源于英国的拉格比（Rugby）学校，因此得名。
collocations: play rugby (打橄榄球), rugby player (橄榄球运动员), rugby ball (橄榄球)
image_prompt: A group of players in a dynamic scrum during a rugby match on a muddy field.

name: calligraphy
chn: n. 书法,书法艺术
example_en: Chinese calligraphy is a beautiful art form.
example_cn: 中国书法是一种美丽的艺术形式。
word_family: calligrapher (n. 书法家)
memory_tips: calli- (beautiful) + graphy (writing)。美丽的字，就是“书法”。
collocations: Chinese calligraphy (中国书法), practice calligraphy (练习书法), a piece of calligraphy (一幅书法作品)
image_prompt: An elegant hand holding a traditional calligraphy brush, writing a beautiful Chinese character on rice paper.

name: nest
chn: n. 鸟窝;巢穴,窝
example_en: The bird built its nest in the tall tree.
example_cn: 那只鸟在高高的树上筑了巢。
word_family: nest (v. 筑巢), nesting (n. 筑巢; adj. 筑巢的)
memory_tips: 联想：'nest'和'rest'（休息）押韵，鸟巢是鸟儿休息的地方。
collocations: bird's nest (鸟巢), build a nest (筑巢), feather one's nest (中饱私囊)
image_prompt: A detailed close-up of a bird's nest made of twigs and leaves, nestled securely on a tree branch, with three small blue eggs inside.

name: roof
chn: n. 屋顶,顶部
example_en: The rain is leaking through the roof.
example_cn: 雨水正从屋顶漏下来。
word_family: rooftop (n. 屋顶平台), roofing (n. 屋顶材料)
memory_tips: 记忆：'roof' 听起来像'入户'，进门入户之前，先看到'屋顶'。
collocations: under one roof (在同一屋檐下), hit the roof (勃然大怒), a roof over one's head (一个安身之处)
image_prompt: Raindrops falling on an old tiled roof, with some water seeping through a small crack into an attic. The scene is viewed from inside the attic, looking up.

name: battle
chn: n. & vt. & vi. 争论;战斗,搏斗;斗争
example_en: The soldiers prepared for a fierce battle.
example_cn: 士兵们为一场激烈的战斗做好了准备。
word_family: battleship (n. 战舰), battlefield (n. 战场)
memory_tips: 记忆：'battle'听起来像'拜托'，打仗前祈祷'拜托'一定要胜利。
collocations: a fierce battle (激战), battle against (与…作斗争), a running battle (持续的争论)
image_prompt: A group of medieval knights in full armor with swords and shields, clashing on a muddy battlefield under a stormy sky.

synonym_diff.quick_guide: battle 指一场具体的战斗；war 指长期的战争；fight 是通用词，可指打斗或争吵；combat 较正式，指战斗；conflict 指冲突或矛盾。

details.focus: 指国家或群体间长期的、大规模的武装冲突。
details.example: The country was torn apart by civil war.

details.focus: 最通用的词，可指个人打斗、争吵或为目标而努力。
details.example: The two boys had a fight in the playground.

details.focus: 常用于军事语境，指积极的战斗行为。
details.example: He was killed in combat.

name: see eye to eye
chn: （在某事上）与某人看法一致
example_en: My sister and I don't see eye to eye on politics.
example_cn: 我和我姐姐在政治上看法不一。
memory_tips: 记忆：想象两个人眼睛看着眼睛（eye to eye），视线在同一水平线上，表示观点完全一致。
collocations: see eye to eye with someone (与某人看法一致), see eye to eye on something (在某事上看法一致)
image_prompt: Two people, a man and a woman, standing face to face, smiling and nodding in agreement, with a speech bubble above them showing identical symbols.

name: argument
chn: n. 争吵,争论;论点
example_en: They had an argument about where to go for dinner.
example_cn: 他们为去哪里吃晚饭而争吵。
word_family: argument n. 争论,争吵;论点,论据,理由 → argue vi. 争吵,争辩,争论 vt. 说理,论证
memory_tips: 来自argue (v. 争论) + -ment (名词后缀)。记住动词形式就能记住名词。
collocations: have an argument (发生争吵), a heated argument (激烈的争论), a strong argument (有力的论点)
image_prompt: A couple sitting at a dining table, looking angry and pointing fingers at each other, not eating the food in front of them.

synonym_diff.quick_guide: argument 指因意见不合的争论或争吵；quarrel 侧重于因愤怒情绪导致的争吵；debate 指正式的辩论；dispute 指更持久的、正式的争端。

details.focus: 通常是愤怒的、私人的争吵，可能不涉及逻辑。
details.example: The children are always quarreling over their toys.

details.focus: 正式的、有组织的讨论或辩论，双方陈述理由。
details.example: The candidates will have a debate on economic policy.

name: teenager
chn: n. 青少年
example_en: Being a teenager can be a challenging time.
example_cn: 作为一名青少年可能是一段充满挑战的时期。
word_family: teenage (adj. 十几岁的), teen (n. 青少年)
memory_tips: 由 'teen' (十几) + 'ager' (表示…年龄的人) 构成。指年龄在 thirteen (13) 到 nineteen (19) 之间的人。
collocations: a typical teenager (一个典型的青少年), teenage angst (青春期焦虑)
image_prompt: A diverse group of teenagers laughing and talking together in a park, some listening to music with headphones, some looking at a smartphone.

name: tension
chn: n. 紧张关系;紧张;拉伸
example_en: You could feel the tension in the room before the exam results were announced.
example_cn: 在考试成绩公布前，你能感觉到房间里的紧张气氛。
word_family: tense (adj. 紧张的; v. 拉紧), tensity (n. 紧张度)
memory_tips: 词根 'tens' 意为 'stretch' (拉伸)，比如 'extend'。紧张就是精神或肌肉被'拉伸'到极致的感觉。
collocations: political tension (政治紧张), muscle tension (肌肉紧张), relieve tension (缓解紧张)
image_prompt: A group of people sitting silently in a waiting room, looking anxious and glancing at a closed door. The air seems thick and heavy.

name: anxious
chn: adj. 忧虑的,担心的;令人焦虑的;渴望的
example_en: He was anxious about his first day at the new job.
example_cn: 他对在新公司的第一天感到焦虑。
word_family: anxious adj. 忧虑的,担心的;令人焦虑的;渴望的 → anxiety n. 焦虑 → anxiously adv. 焦虑地
memory_tips: 发音 'anxious' 听起来像 '俺克死'，一想到要考试就焦虑得 '俺克死' 了，可以帮助记忆其'焦虑'的含义。
collocations: anxious about (为...焦虑), anxious for (渴望得到), anxious to do sth (渴望做某事)
image_prompt: A young man in a suit standing outside an office door, nervously adjusting his tie and checking his watch.

synonym_diff.quick_guide: anxious 指对未来的不确定性感到强烈不安；worried 是普遍的担心；concerned 更侧重于关心；eager 是当anxious表示'渴望'时的近义词。

details.focus: 对已经发生或可能发生的不好的事感到不快或不安。
details.example: I'm worried about her health.

details.focus: 更正式，表示出于关心和责任感的担忧。
details.example: The teacher is concerned about the student's progress.

details.focus: 表示强烈的、积极的期盼，与 anxious 的'渴望'义相近。
details.example: She was eager to start her new job.

name: rate
chn: n. 速度;率 vi. & vt. 评价,评估
example_en: The crime rate has dropped significantly this year.
example_cn: 今年的犯罪率显著下降。
word_family: rating (n. 评级, 等级), overrate (v. 高估), underrate (v. 低估)
memory_tips: 联想：给商品评级(rate)后，价格(rate)就定下来了。
collocations: at any rate (无论如何), interest rate (利率), at a high rate (高速地), first-rate (一流的)
image_prompt: A dynamic infographic chart with a downward-trending arrow labeled 'Crime Rate', with city buildings in the background.

name: shoot
chn: vi. & vt. (shot, shot)（使朝某方向）冲,奔;射击;射杀;摄影
example_en: The car shot past us at high speed.
example_cn: 那辆车飞速地从我们身边驶过。
word_family: shot (n. 射击;开枪;镜头), shooting (n. 射击;拍摄)
memory_tips: 想象子弹'咻'的一声飞出去，发音很像'shoot'。
collocations: shoot a film (拍电影), shoot a goal (射门), shoot a look (瞥了一眼)
image_prompt: A red sports car blurring as it speeds down a highway, seen from the perspective of a slower car being overtaken.

name: shoot up
chn: 快速长高,蹿个儿
example_en: My son has really shot up in the last year.
example_cn: 我儿子在过去一年里蹿得真快。
memory_tips: 记忆：像竹笋(bamboo shoot)一样向上(up)快速生长。
collocations: prices shoot up (价格飞涨), plants shoot up (植物猛长)
image_prompt: A height chart on a wall with pencil marks showing a significant jump in a child's height over one year. A smiling boy stands next to it proudly.

name: spot
chn: n. 粉刺;斑点;污渍;地点,场所
example_en: This is the exact spot where the accident happened.
example_cn: 这里就是事故发生的确切地点。
word_family: spotless (adj. 洁净的), spotlight (n. 聚光灯), spotted (adj. 有斑点的)
memory_tips: 联想：用聚光灯(spotlight)照亮一个地点(spot)，发现了一个斑点(spot)。
collocations: on the spot (当场), a blind spot (盲点), a beauty spot (美人痣;风景区)
image_prompt: A street intersection with a red 'X' marked on the pavement, indicating a specific location. A detective is examining the spot.

name: target
chn: n.（攻击的）目标,对象;靶子 vt. 把…作为攻击目标;面向
example_en: The company's new advertisement targets young consumers.
example_cn: 公司的新广告面向年轻消费者。
word_family: targeted (adj. 目标明确的)
memory_tips: 记忆：想象射箭时，大喊一声'他急它'，然后箭就射向了靶子(target)。
collocations: a prime target (主要目标), target audience (目标受众), on target (命中目标)
image_prompt: A vibrant and modern advertisement on a billboard, featuring young people using a new tech gadget, clearly aimed at a youthful market.

synonym_diff.quick_guide: target 是具体、可攻击或可达到的靶子；goal 是需要长期努力实现的最终目标；aim 是意图或方向；objective 是具体、可衡量的短期目标。

details.focus: 长期的、宏大的最终目的。
details.example: My goal is to run a marathon next year.

details.focus: 行动的意图或努力的方向。
details.example: The aim of the project is to improve communication.

details.focus: 为实现更大目标而设定的具体、可衡量的步骤。
details.example: Our objective this month is to increase sales by 10%.

name: anger
chn: n. 怒气,怒火
example_en: He couldn't hide his anger at the unfair decision.
example_cn: 他无法掩饰对不公平决定的愤怒。
word_family: anger n. 怒气,怒火 v. 使发怒;激怒 → angry adj. 生气的 → angrily adv. 生气地
memory_tips: 联想 'danger' (危险)。愤怒(anger)的时候，人会变得很危险(danger)。
collocations: a fit of anger (一阵愤怒), filled with anger (充满怒火), control one's anger (控制愤怒)
image_prompt: A man's face in close-up, with a flushed red complexion, clenched jaw, and furrowed brows, clearly showing intense anger.

name: mental
chn: adj. 思想的,精神的,智力的
example_en: Yoga is good for both physical and mental health.
example_cn: 瑜伽对身心健康都有好处。
word_family: mental adj. 思想的,精神的,智力的 → mentally adv. 思想上,精神上,智力上
memory_tips: 词根'ment'表示'mind'（思想），比如'comment'（评论）、'mention'（提及）。
collocations: mental health (心理健康), mental ability (智力), mental arithmetic (心算)
image_prompt: A silhouette of a person's head with glowing, interconnected lines and gears inside, symbolizing thought processes and mental well-being.

name: adult
chn: n. 成年人
example_en: You need to be an adult to watch this movie.
example_cn: 你需要是成年人才能看这部电影。
word_family: adulthood (n. 成年期)
memory_tips: 联想：成年人(adult)做事需要'爱叨特'（唠叨特别多），因为要考虑周全。
collocations: a young adult (青年), adult education (成人教育)
image_prompt: A person showing their ID card to a cinema ticket checker, with a movie poster in the background that has an '18+' rating symbol.

name: desire
chn: n. & vt. 渴望,希望
example_en: He has a strong desire to travel the world.
example_cn: 他有环游世界的强烈愿望。
word_family: desirable (adj. 值得拥有的, 理想的), undesirable (adj. 不受欢迎的), desirability (n. 愿望, 吸引力)
memory_tips: 词根 'sire' 意为 'star' (星星)，古人向星星许愿，表达'渴望'。
collocations: a strong desire (强烈的愿望), a burning desire (迫切的愿望), desire for success (对成功的渴望)
image_prompt: A young person looking out a window at a starry night sky, with a thought bubble showing a map of the world with pins in various locations.

synonym_diff.quick_guide: desire 是较正式的强烈渴望；want 是最普通的'想要'；wish 常指难以实现的愿望；long for 是长期而深切的盼望；crave 指身体或情感上难以抑制的渴求。

details.focus: 最常见、最普通的'想要'。
details.example: I want a cup of coffee.

details.focus: 通常指对不可能或不太可能实现的事情的期盼。
details.example: I wish I could fly.

details.focus: 表达一种深切的、持续的思念或盼望。
details.example: She longed for the days of her childhood.

name: struggle
chn: vi. & n. 奋斗;斗争;搏斗
example_en: The small company is struggling to survive in a competitive market.
example_cn: 这家小公司在竞争激烈的市场中挣扎求存。
word_family: struggling (adj. 努力奋斗的)
memory_tips: 发音联想：'struggle' -> '死抓够'，在困境中要'死死抓住'才'能够'活下来，体现了'挣扎、奋斗'的含义。
collocations: struggle for survival (为生存而斗争), struggle with a problem (与问题作斗争), a power struggle (权力斗争)
image_prompt: A tiny plant sprout breaking through a crack in dry, hard pavement, reaching towards the sunlight.

name: rough
chn: adj. 艰难的;粗糙的;不确切的
example_en: He had a rough time after losing his job.
example_cn: 失业后他度过了一段艰难的时光。
word_family: rough adj. 艰难的;粗糙的;不确切的 n. 草图;草稿 → roughly adv. 大约,大致;粗暴地;粗糙地
memory_tips: 联想'tough'（艰难的），它们发音和意思都相近。'rough' 还可指'粗糙'，如'rough paper'。
collocations: a rough sea (波涛汹涌的大海), a rough idea (一个大概的想法), a rough draft (草稿)
image_prompt: A man sitting alone on a park bench in autumn, looking dejected, with fallen leaves around him.

name: breakdown
chn: n.（关系）破裂;故障
example_en: There was a breakdown in communication between the two leaders.
example_cn: 两位领导人之间的沟通出现了破裂。
word_family: break down (v. 失败;分解;出故障)
memory_tips: 由 'break' (打破) 和 'down' (向下) 组成，可以理解为彻底坏掉了、崩溃了。
collocations: a nervous breakdown (精神崩溃), a communication breakdown (沟通中断), a car breakdown (汽车故障)
image_prompt: Two figures are shown with their backs to each other, a jagged crack running down the space between them, symbolizing a communication failure.

name: regular
chn: adj. 频繁的;有规律的
example_en: He makes regular visits to his grandmother.
example_cn: 他定期去看望他的祖母。
word_family: regular adj. 频繁的;有规律的 → regularly adv. 定期地;有规律地
memory_tips: 联想：'regular' 像 'regulate' (管理，规定)，有规律的事情是按规定(regulation)来的。
collocations: a regular customer (常客), regular exercise (有规律的锻炼), on a regular basis (定期地)
image_prompt: A calendar page with several dates circled in the same color, indicating a recurring event. A friendly person is shown knocking on a door.

name: calm
chn: vt. 使平静,使镇静 adj. 镇静的,沉着的
example_en: She took a deep breath to calm herself.
example_cn: 她深吸一口气使自己平静下来。
word_family: calm vt. 使平静,使镇静 adj. 镇静的,沉着的 → calmly adv. 平静地 → calmness n. 平静
memory_tips: 联想：发音像'蛤蟆'，想象一只安静的蛤蟆(calm)一动不动地待在荷叶上。
collocations: keep calm (保持镇静), a calm sea (平静的大海), calm down (冷静下来)
image_prompt: A woman sitting in a serene yoga pose by a tranquil lake at sunrise, with her eyes closed and a peaceful expression on her face.

name: calm down
chn: 平静,镇静,安静
example_en: Calm down and tell me what happened.
example_cn: 冷静下来，告诉我发生了什么。
memory_tips: 由 'calm' (平静) 和 'down' (向下) 组成，表示让激动的情绪'平复下去'。
collocations: tell someone to calm down (让某人冷静)
image_prompt: A person placing a gentle hand on the shoulder of a very agitated and upset friend, speaking softly to them.

name: view
chn: n. 看法;视线;景色 vt. 把…视为;观看
example_en: In my view, this is the best solution to the problem.
example_cn: 在我看来，这是解决问题的最佳方案。
word_family: view n. 看法;视线;景色 vt. 把……视为;观看 → viewer n. 观众
memory_tips: 可以和 'review' (回顾，评论) 一起记，'re-' (再次) + 'view' (看) = 再次看，即回顾。
collocations: point of view (观点), in view of (鉴于), a room with a view (有风景的房间)
image_prompt: A person standing at a crossroads with multiple signposts, pointing confidently towards one path labeled 'Best Solution'.

synonym_diff.quick_guide: view 指个人看法；opinion 是一般的'意见'；perspective 指看待事物的'角度'；viewpoint 是'立场'；outlook 指对未来的'看法'。

details.focus: 个人的信念或判断，不一定基于事实。
details.example: What's your opinion of the new policy?

details.focus: 看待事物的特定方式或角度，常受个人经历影响。
details.example: From a historical perspective, the event was significant.

name: from one's point of view
chn: 从某人的角度、观点出发
example_en: From my point of view, family is more important than work.
example_cn: 从我的观点来看，家庭比工作更重要。
memory_tips: 字面意思：'from' (从) + 'one's point of view' (一个人的观点)，非常直白。
collocations: look at something from another point of view (从另一个角度看问题)
image_prompt: A person standing on a small platform labeled 'My Point of View', looking at a scale balancing 'Family' and 'Work', with the 'Family' side weighing more.

name: think through
chn: 充分考虑,全盘考虑,想透
example_en: We need to think this plan through carefully before we start.
example_cn: 在开始之前，我们需要仔细地把这个计划想清楚。
memory_tips: 记忆：'think' (思考) + 'through' (从头到尾，穿过)，表示把一个问题的里里外外都思考一遍。
collocations: think a problem through (想透一个问题), think through the consequences (仔细考虑后果)
image_prompt: A person sitting at a desk with a complex flowchart on a large piece of paper, using a pencil to trace the connections from 'Start' to 'Finish'.

name: concern
chn: n. 担心,忧虑;关心 vt. 涉及;让（某人）担忧
example_en: The rise in pollution is a major concern for the local residents.
example_cn: 污染的加剧是当地居民主要担忧的问题。
word_family: concern n. 担心,忧虑;关心 vt. 涉及;让（某人）担忧;（对……）感兴趣 → concerned adj. 有关的;关心的 → concerning prep. 关于,涉及
memory_tips: 联想：con-(共同) + cern-(关心)，大家'共同关心'的问题就是'concern'。
collocations: express concern (表达担忧), a matter of concern (一个令人担忧的问题), be concerned about (关心...)
image_prompt: A group of concerned citizens looking at a factory in the distance with smoke billowing from its chimneys, polluting the air above their town.

synonym_diff.quick_guide: concern 更正式，强调责任感和关切；worry 是普遍的担心和烦恼；anxiety 是对未来的强烈不安和紧张；care 是关心和在意。

details.focus: 一种持续的、令人不快的思虑状态。
details.example: His parents worry about his future.

details.focus: 更强烈的、常常是模糊的紧张和恐惧感。
details.example: She suffers from anxiety before exams.

name: back down
chn: 承认错误,认输
example_en: Neither side is willing to back down in the negotiation.
example_cn: 在谈判中，双方都不愿意让步。
memory_tips: 记忆：从一个强硬的立场'后退' (back) '下来' (down)，表示放弃原有立场，即认输。
collocations: back down from an argument (在争论中让步), refuse to back down (拒绝认输)
image_prompt: Two chess players sitting opposite each other. One player knocks over their own king, a universal sign of surrendering the game.

name: normal
chn: adj. 正常的,一般的 n. 常态,通常标准
example_en: After the storm, everything returned to normal.
example_cn: 暴风雨过后，一切恢复了正常。
word_family: normal adj. 正常的,一般的 n. 常态,通常标准 → abnormal adj. 反常的;畸形的
memory_tips: 词根 'norm' 就是'标准，规范'的意思。符合规范的(norm-al)就是'正常的'。
collocations: back to normal (恢复正常), normal temperature (正常体温), above/below normal (高于/低于正常水平)
image_prompt: A split image: the left side shows a chaotic, stormy scene; the right side shows the same scene, but now sunny and peaceful, with people resuming their daily activities.

name: stress
chn: n. 精神压力,紧张;强调 vt. 强调,着重
example_en: Working long hours can cause a lot of stress.
example_cn: 长时间工作会造成很大的压力。
word_family: stress n. 精神压力,紧张;强调 vt. 强调,着重 → stressful adj. 有压力的（修饰事物）→ stressed adj. 焦虑不安的（形容人的感受或表情）
memory_tips: 联想：压力(stress)让人痛苦，就像被压在一堆石头(stone)下，发音有点像'死拽死'，压力大得快要把人拽死了。
collocations: under stress (在压力下), relieve stress (缓解压力), lay stress on (强调)
image_prompt: An office worker sitting at a desk with a huge, heavy weight labeled 'WORK' pressing down on their shoulders. The worker looks overwhelmed and tired.

name: editor
chn: n. 主编,编辑;剪辑师
example_en: She works as an editor for a famous fashion magazine.
example_cn: 她在一家著名的时尚杂志担任编辑。
word_family: edit (v. 编辑), edition (n. 版本), editorial (adj. 编辑的, n. 社论)
memory_tips: 来自'edit' (编辑) + '-or' (表示人的后缀)。会'edit'的人就是'editor'。
collocations: a chief editor (主编), a film editor (电影剪辑师), a letter to the editor (致编辑的信)
image_prompt: A stylish woman at a modern office desk, using a red pen to mark up a magazine layout spread, surrounded by fashion photos and text samples.

name: argue
chn: vi. 争吵,争辩,争论 vt. 说理,论证
example_en: I don't want to argue with you about this.
example_cn: 我不想和你为这事争论。
word_family: argue vi. 争吵,争辩,争论 vt. 说理,论证 → argument n. 争论,争吵;论点,论据,理由
memory_tips: 发音联想：'啊，古'人都喜欢辩论，所以'argue'是'争论'。
collocations: argue with sb about/over sth (与某人争论某事), argue for/against sth (据理支持/反对某事)
image_prompt: Two people standing with arms crossed, looking away from each other with annoyed expressions, after a disagreement.

synonym_diff.quick_guide: argue 指为说服对方而摆事实、讲道理；debate 指正式的公开辩论；discuss 指为了解或决定某事而讨论；quarrel 指愤怒地争吵。

details.focus: 正式场合下，对一个议题进行正反两方的辩论。
details.example: The politicians debated the new law in parliament.

details.focus: 强调情绪化、不理性的争吵。
details.example: They quarreled over a trivial matter.

name: skin
chn: n. 皮肤;（兽）皮,毛皮
example_en: It's important to protect your skin from the sun.
example_cn: 保护你的皮肤免受阳光照射是很重要的。
word_family: skinny (adj. 极瘦的), skin care (n. 护肤)
memory_tips: 发音联想：'skin' -> '死盯'，别人'死盯'着你看，你会害羞到皮肤(skin)发红。
collocations: fair skin (白皙的皮肤), sensitive skin (敏感性皮肤), by the skin of one's teeth (侥幸地, 勉强地)
image_prompt: A person applying sunscreen to their arm on a sunny beach, with the bright sun and ocean in the background.

name: design
chn: vt. 设计;制订 n. 设计;设计艺术
example_en: She helped to design the new company logo.
example_cn: 她帮助设计了公司的新标志。
word_family: design vt. 设计;制订 n. 设计;设计艺术;打算,意图,目的 → designer n. 设计者
memory_tips: de-(前缀，表示'向下，加强') + sign-(标记)。设计就是画出标记和图案。
collocations: fashion design (时装设计), interior design (室内设计), by design (故意地)
image_prompt: A graphic designer at her computer, using a stylus and tablet to create a sleek, modern logo. Various color palettes and sketches are visible on the screen.

name: forum
chn: n. 论坛,讨论会;公共集会
example_en: He shared his ideas on an online forum.
example_cn: 他在一个在线论坛上分享了他的想法。
memory_tips: 联想：'for um' -> for them (为了他们)，论坛是为了他们(大众)讨论问题而设的。
collocations: an online forum (网络论坛), a public forum (公共论坛), a forum for discussion (讨论的平台)
image_prompt: A computer screen showing a webpage of an internet forum, with various discussion threads and users' posts visible.

name: expert
chn: n. 专家,行家 adj. 熟练的,内行的,专家的
example_en: She is an expert in ancient history.
example_cn: 她是古代史方面的专家。
word_family: expertise (n. 专业知识, 专门技能)
memory_tips: 来自 'experience' (经验)。有丰富经验(experience)的人就成了专家(expert)。
collocations: an expert on/in a subject (某一学科的专家), expert advice (专家建议), an expert opinion (专家意见)
image_prompt: A female archaeologist carefully brushing dust off an ancient pottery shard at an excavation site, looking knowledgeable and focused.

synonym_diff.quick_guide: expert 指在某领域有渊博知识或高超技能的人；specialist 指专攻某一特定狭窄领域的人；professional 指以此为职业且具备专业水准的人。

details.focus: 专注于一个非常具体领域的专家，如医学专科医生。
details.example: You should see a heart specialist.

details.focus: 强调以此为生，并表现出高水平的技能和操守。
details.example: He is a professional photographer.

name: likely
chn: adj. 可能的, 预料的, 有希望的
example_en: It is likely to rain this afternoon.
example_cn: 今天下午很可能会下雨。
word_family: likely adj. 可能的,预料的;有希望的 → unlikely adj. 不可能的,没希望的
memory_tips: 来自 'like' + '-ly'。看起来'像' (like) 要发生的事，就是'可能'的事。
collocations: be likely to do sth (很可能做某事), the most likely outcome (最可能的结果), not likely (不可能)
image_prompt: A sky filled with dark, heavy storm clouds gathering over a city skyline, suggesting imminent rain.

synonym_diff.quick_guide: likely 可能性很大(>50%)；probable 可能性比 likely 更大，几乎确定；possible 仅表示有可能性(>0%)，无论大小。

details.focus: 表示事情有发生的客观条件，但可能性不一定高。
details.example: It's possible to get there by train, but it's slow.

details.focus: 表示有充分的理由和证据相信某事会发生，可能性非常高。
details.example: Based on the evidence, it is probable that he is guilty.

name: unique
chn: adj. 独一无二的;独特的;独具的,特有的
example_en: Each person's fingerprint is unique.
example_cn: 每个人的指纹都是独一无二的。
word_family: uniquely (adv. 独特地), uniqueness (n. 独特性)
memory_tips: 词根 'uni-' 意为'一' (one)，比如'uniform' (统一的服装), 'unicycle' (独轮车)。'unique'就是'只有一个的'。
collocations: unique opportunity (独一无二的机会), unique style (独特的风格), be unique to (为...所特有)
image_prompt: A close-up of a thumb pressing against a glass surface, showing the intricate and distinct patterns of a fingerprint in high detail.

name: passive
chn: adj. 消极的,被动的
example_en: He played a passive role in the discussion, letting others do all the talking.
example_cn: 他在讨论中扮演了一个被动的角色，让别人说完了所有的话。
word_family: passively (adv. 被动地), passivity (n. 被动性)
memory_tips: 联想'pass' (通过，经过)，被动的人总是让机会'pass'过去，自己不主动争取。其反义词是'active'。
collocations: passive smoking (被动吸烟), passive learning (被动学习), passive voice (被动语态)
image_prompt: A person sitting at the edge of a group meeting, leaning back in their chair with arms crossed, while everyone else is actively engaged in discussion.

name: performance
chn: n. 表现;表演;执行,履行
example_en: The actor's performance in the play was outstanding.
example_cn: 那位演员在剧中的表演非常出色。
word_family: performance n. 表现;表演;执行,履行 → perform v. 执行,履行,做;机器运转;表演 → performer n. 表演者
memory_tips: 来自'perform' (v. 表演) + '-ance' (名词后缀)。
collocations: job performance (工作表现), academic performance (学业表现), a live performance (现场表演)
image_prompt: An actor on a theater stage, under a single spotlight, taking a bow as the audience gives a standing ovation.

name: cheer up
chn: （ 使）变得高兴,振奋起来
example_en: I bought her some flowers to cheer her up.
example_cn: 我给她买了一些花让她高兴起来。
word_family: cheer (v. & n. 欢呼), cheerful (adj. 高兴的), cheerfully (adv. 高兴地)
memory_tips: 'cheer' 本身是欢呼，'up' 表示情绪向上，所以 'cheer up' 就是让情绪振奋起来。
collocations: cheer someone up (让某人振作)
image_prompt: A person handing a vibrant bouquet of flowers to a sad-looking friend, who is beginning to smile.

name: press
chn: vt. & vi. 催促,逼迫;按,压;挤,推 n. 报章杂志,报刊;（the press）新闻工作者,新闻界
example_en: She felt pressed to make a decision quickly.
example_cn: 她感到被迫要迅速做出决定。
word_family: press v. 催促,逼迫;按,压;挤,推 n. 报章杂志,报刊;（the press）新闻工作者,新闻界 → pressing adj. 紧迫的,迫切的
memory_tips: 联想：压力(pressure)就是来自'press' (压)。印刷机(printing press)也是通过'压'来印字的，所以'press'也指新闻界。
collocations: press a button (按按钮), press conference (新闻发布会), freedom of the press (新闻自由)
image_prompt: A businesswoman surrounded by clocks ticking loudly, feeling overwhelmed and pressured to make a choice between two documents.

name: eager
chn: adj. 热切的,渴望的,渴求的
example_en: The children were eager to open their Christmas presents.
example_cn: 孩子们渴望打开他们的圣诞礼物。
word_family: eager adj. 热切的,渴望的,渴求的 → eagerly adv. 热切地,渴望地 → eagerness n. 热切,渴望
memory_tips: 发音联想：'eager' -> '鹰哥'，'鹰哥'非常'渴望'能展翅高飞。
collocations: eager for success (渴望成功), eager to learn (渴望学习), an eager beaver (做事非常卖力的人)
image_prompt: A group of excited children gathered around a Christmas tree, reaching out with sparkling eyes towards the brightly wrapped presents underneath.

synonym_diff.quick_guide: eager 是积极的、兴奋的渴望；anxious (作'渴望'解时) 带有焦虑和不安；keen 强调强烈的兴趣和热情。

details.focus: 当表示'渴望'时，通常带有'等不及'的焦急心态。
details.example: He is anxious for the test results.

details.focus: 表示对某事有强烈的兴趣和热情，特别用于英式英语。
details.example: She is a keen photographer.

name: youth
chn: n. 青年时期;青春;（the youth）年轻人
example_en: He was a talented musician in his youth.
example_cn: 他年轻时是一位才华横溢的音乐家。
word_family: youthful (adj. 年轻的, 富有朝气的)
memory_tips: 与 'young' (年轻的) 同源，可以联系记忆。
collocations: the follies of youth (年轻时的蠢事), youth hostel (青年旅社), eternal youth (永葆青春)
image_prompt: An old black-and-white photo showing a young man with long hair happily playing a guitar on a small stage in the 1970s.

name: adventure
chn: n. 冒险,冒险经历,奇遇
example_en: Going to the Amazon rainforest was a great adventure.
example_cn: 去亚马逊雨林是一次伟大的探险。
word_family: adventurous (adj. 爱冒险的, 充满危险的), adventurer (n. 探险家)
memory_tips: ad-(去) + venture (冒险)。'venture'本身就是冒险，比如'joint venture'(合资企业)。
collocations: a sense of adventure (冒险精神), adventure story (冒险故事), seek adventure (寻求冒险)
image_prompt: An explorer wearing a hat and safari clothes, looking with awe at a vast, dense jungle with a winding river and exotic birds flying overhead.

name: be on someone's back
chn: 缠磨,烦扰
example_en: My boss has been on my back all week about the report.
example_cn: 为那份报告，我老板这周一直缠着我。
memory_tips: 想象有个人一直骑在你的背上(on your back)，不停地催促你，非常形象地表达了'烦扰'之意。
collocations: get off my back (别来烦我)
image_prompt: A stressed office worker at his desk, with a tiny, annoying figure of his boss literally sitting on his back, pointing at the computer screen.

name: kangaroo
chn: n. 袋鼠
example_en: The kangaroo carries its baby in a pouch.
example_cn: 袋鼠把它的宝宝放在育儿袋里。
memory_tips: 外来词，发音独特。联想：'看个鹿'，结果不是鹿，是'袋鼠'。
collocations: a kangaroo court (袋鼠法庭, 非法法庭)
image_prompt: A large kangaroo standing in the Australian outback, with a small joey (baby kangaroo) peeking out from its mother's pouch.

name: flexible
chn: adj. 灵活的,可变动的;柔韧的
example_en: Our travel plans are flexible.
example_cn: 我们的旅行计划是灵活的。
word_family: flexible adj. 灵活的,可变动的;柔韧的 → inflexible adj. 不灵活的 → flexibly adv. 灵活地;柔软地;有弹性地
memory_tips: 词根 'flex' 意为'弯曲'，比如'reflect' (反射)。能弯曲的(flexible)就是'柔韧的，灵活的'。
collocations: flexible working hours (弹性工作时间), a flexible approach (灵活的方法), stay flexible (保持灵活)
image_prompt: A travel itinerary displayed on a tablet, with several options for flights and hotels that can be easily swapped around with a finger swipe.

name: account
chn: n. 账户;描述;解释 vt. 认为是,视为
example_en: I need to withdraw some money from my bank account.
example_cn: 我需要从我的银行账户里取些钱。
word_family: accountant (n. 会计), accounting (n. 会计学)
memory_tips: 联想：会计(accountant)的工作就是算账(account)。
collocations: bank account (银行账户), take into account (考虑到), on account of (由于)
image_prompt: A person using an ATM, inserting a bank card into the slot. The screen shows a balance and options to withdraw or deposit.

name: rent
chn: n. 租金 vi. & vt. 租用;出租
example_en: They pay their rent at the beginning of every month.
example_cn: 他们每个月初付房租。
word_family: rental (n. 租金;租赁 adj. 租赁的)
memory_tips: 联想：租(rent)房子要花钱(cent)，rent和cent发音相近。
collocations: pay the rent (付房租), for rent (供出租), rent a car (租车)
image_prompt: A hand giving cash to another hand in front of an apartment door, with a calendar in the background showing the 1st of the month circled.

name: grocery
chn: n. 食品杂货;食品杂货店
example_en: I need to stop at the grocery store to buy some milk.
example_cn: 我得在食品杂货店停一下，买些牛奶。
word_family: grocer (n. 食品杂货商), groceries (n. 食品杂货)
memory_tips: 联想：'grow' (生长)，杂货店卖的很多是地里'长'出来的东西。
collocations: grocery store (食品杂货店), grocery list (购物清单), buy groceries (买菜)
image_prompt: A person pushing a shopping cart down the aisle of a grocery store, reaching for a carton of milk from the refrigerated section.

name: secure
chn: adj. 安心的;可靠的;牢固的
example_en: Make sure the ladder is secure before you climb it.
example_cn: 爬梯子前要确保梯子是牢固的。
word_family: security (n. 安全), securely (adv. 安全地), insecure (adj. 不安全的)
memory_tips: se- (分开) + cure (关心，照料)。'分开心思去照料'，确保一切'安全'。
collocations: feel secure (感到安心), a secure job (一份稳定的工作), secure a victory (确保胜利)
image_prompt: A person testing a ladder by shaking it firmly before starting to climb. The ladder is placed on level ground and leaned against a solid wall.

name: graduate
chn: vi. & vt. 毕业 n. 毕业生
example_en: She will graduate from university next year.
example_cn: 她明年将大学毕业。
word_family: graduate v. 毕业 n. 毕业生 → graduation n. 毕业
memory_tips: 词根'grad'意为'步，等级'，如'grade'(年级)。'graduate'就是完成所有'等级'的学习，迈出新的一'步'。
collocations: graduate from (从...毕业), a high school graduate (高中毕业生), graduate school (研究生院)
image_prompt: A happy young woman in a graduation cap and gown, holding a diploma and tossing her cap in the air with other graduates.

name: gather
chn: vi. 聚集,集合 vt. 收拢;搜集,收集;聚集
example_en: A crowd began to gather around the street performers.
example_cn: 一群人开始聚集在街头艺人周围。
word_family: gather vi. 聚集,集合 vt. 收拢;搜集,收集;聚集 → gathering n. 聚会;集会;聚集;采集
memory_tips: 联想：'ga-ther' -> 'gether' -> 'together' (一起)。'gather'就是让大家'聚在一起'。
collocations: gather information (收集信息), gather strength (积蓄力量), gather dust (积满灰尘)
image_prompt: A crowd of people of all ages forming a circle around a musician playing a guitar in a city square.

synonym_diff.quick_guide: gather 指人或物自然地聚集到一起；collect 侧重有目的地把东西收拢起来；assemble 强调为了一个共同目的而集合（人）或组装（物）。

details.focus: 有选择、有目的地收集同类物品。
details.example: He collects rare stamps.

details.focus: 把人或事物的各部分组合成一个整体。
details.example: The students assembled in the hall.

name: emergency
chn: n. 突发事件,紧急情况
example_en: In an emergency, dial 911.
example_cn: 在紧急情况下，请拨打911。
word_family: emerge (v. 出现, 浮现), emergent (adj. 紧急的, 出现的)
memory_tips: 来自'emerge' (出现)，突然出现(emerge)的状况就是'紧急情况'。
collocations: emergency exit (紧急出口), state of emergency (紧急状态), in case of emergency (万一发生紧急情况)
image_prompt: A hand urgently dialing '911' on a smartphone, with a blurred background of flashing red and blue lights.

name: volunteer
chn: vt. & vi. 主动建议（或告诉）;自愿做,义务做 n. 志愿者
example_en: He volunteered to help clean up the park.
example_cn: 他自愿帮忙打扫公园。
word_family: volunteer v. 主动建议（或告诉）;自愿做,义务做 n. 志愿者 → voluntary adj. 自愿的;志愿的;自发的
memory_tips: 词根 'vol' 意为 'will' (意愿)，比如'volition'(意志)。'volunteer'就是凭自己意愿做事的人。
collocations: volunteer work (志愿工作), volunteer for a task (自愿承担一项任务)
image_prompt: A diverse group of cheerful people wearing matching t-shirts, picking up litter in a park on a sunny day.

name: pipe
chn: n. 烟斗;管子;管乐器
example_en: A plumber was called to fix the broken water pipe.
example_cn: 我们叫了个水管工来修理破裂的水管。
word_family: pipeline (n. 管道), piping (n. 管道系统)
memory_tips: 发音联想：'pipe' -> '拍拍'，水管工'拍拍'水管(pipe)听声音，检查哪里漏水。
collocations: a water pipe (水管), a smoking pipe (烟斗), pipe dream (白日梦)
image_prompt: A plumber with a toolbox kneeling on a kitchen floor, working on a leaky pipe under the sink with a wrench.

name: figure
chn: n. 数字;人物;体形,身材
example_en: The sales figures for this quarter are very impressive.
example_cn: 本季度的销售数字非常亮眼。
word_family: figure out (v. 解决;弄明白), figurine (n. 小塑像)
memory_tips: 一词多义。联想：计算数字(figure)来保持好身材(figure)，成为重要人物(figure)。
collocations: a key figure (关键人物), a slim figure (苗条的身材), figure of speech (修辞格), go figure (真奇怪)
image_prompt: A business presentation screen showing a bar chart with rapidly rising bars, labeled 'Sales Figures', with a smiling presenter pointing at it.

name: downtown
chn: adv. 在市中心,往市中心
example_en: Let's go downtown for dinner and a movie.
example_cn: 我们去市中心吃晚饭看电影吧。
memory_tips: 由 'down' + 'town' 组成。在很多城市，市中心是地势较低或沿河的区域，所以是'down' town。
collocations: downtown area (市中心区), go downtown (去市中心)
image_prompt: A vibrant city street at night, with bright neon signs for restaurants and a cinema, and people walking on the sidewalks.

name: draw out
chn: 提取,支取
example_en: I need to draw out some cash for the weekend.
example_cn: 我需要取些现金过周末。
memory_tips: 'draw' 有'拉，拔'的意思，'out' 是'出来'。从银行账户里把钱'拉出来'就是'提取'。
collocations: draw money out of an account (从账户取钱)
image_prompt: A close-up of cash being dispensed from an ATM slot into a person's waiting hand.

synonym_diff.quick_guide: draw out 是口语化的'取钱'；withdraw 是更正式、标准的说法。

details.focus: 银行术语，正式表示从账户中取款。
details.example: He withdrew $200 from his savings account.

name: operation
chn: n. 手术;运转,操作
example_en: The patient is recovering well after the operation.
example_cn: 病人在手术后恢复得很好。
word_family: operate (v. 做手术;操作), operator (n. 操作员), operational (adj. 操作的)
memory_tips: 来自'operate' (操作，做手术)，-ion是名词后缀。
collocations: a surgical operation (外科手术), in operation (在运转中), a military operation (军事行动)
image_prompt: A patient lying in a hospital bed, smiling weakly as a nurse checks their chart. Sunlight is streaming through the window.

name: lap
chn: n. 大腿部
example_en: The cat curled up on her lap and went to sleep.
example_cn: 那只猫蜷缩在她的腿上睡着了。
word_family: laptop (n. 笔记本电脑)
memory_tips: 联想：可以放在大腿(lap)上用的电脑就是'laptop'。
collocations: sit on someone's lap (坐在某人腿上), a victory lap (胜利圈跑)
image_prompt: A fluffy ginger cat sleeping peacefully on a person's lap as they sit in a comfy armchair, reading a book.

name: teller
chn: n. 出纳员;叙述者
example_en: The bank teller counted the money carefully.
example_cn: 银行出纳员仔细地数着钱。
word_family: tell (v. 告诉), storyteller (n. 讲故事的人)
memory_tips: 来自'tell' (告诉) + '-er' (人)。在银行'告诉'你账户信息的人就是'teller'。
collocations: a bank teller (银行出纳员), a fortune teller (算命先生)
image_prompt: A friendly bank teller behind a counter, smiling at a customer while handing them a stack of cash.

name: scene
chn: n.（戏剧等）场;场面,片段;地点,现场;景象,风光
example_en: The police arrived at the scene of the crime.
example_cn: 警察到达了犯罪现场。
word_family: scene n. （戏剧等）场;场面,片段;地点,现场;景象,风光 → scenery n. 风景,景色
memory_tips: 联想：电影(cinema)里有很多场景(scene)。
collocations: behind the scenes (在幕后), make a scene (大吵大闹), the opening scene (开场)
image_prompt: A crime scene cordoned off with yellow police tape, with detectives in the background examining clues.

name: flat
chn: n. 公寓 adj. 平坦的;瘪了的
example_en: She lives in a small flat in the city center.
example_cn: 她住在市中心的一套小公寓里。
word_family: flatten (v. 使变平)
memory_tips: 英国常用'flat'表示公寓，美国常用'apartment'。作为形容词，'flat'指平坦的，比如'flat ground'(平地)。
collocations: a block of flats (公寓楼), a flat tire (瘪了的轮胎), flat shoes (平底鞋)
image_prompt: The exterior of a modern apartment building, with a zoom-in on one window of a cozy, well-lit flat.

name: response
chn: n. 回复;反应,响应
example_en: We received an immediate response to our request for help.
example_cn: 我们的求助请求得到了立即的回应。
word_family: response n. 回复;反应,响应 → respond vi. 回答;响应;作出反应
memory_tips: 来自'respond' (v. 回应)，-se是名词形式。
collocations: in response to (作为对...的回应), a quick response (快速的反应), a positive response (积极的回应)
image_prompt: A person looking at their phone with a relieved and happy expression, having just received a positive reply message to an urgent request.

synonym_diff.quick_guide: response 是对刺激或请求的反应；reply 是对问题或信件的直接回答；answer 是对问题的具体解答；reaction 是情感或行为上的反应。

details.focus: 通常指书面或口头的直接回答。
details.example: He sent a reply to my email.

details.focus: 针对一个问题给出的信息。
details.example: What is the answer to question 5?

details.focus: 更侧重于情感上或本能上的反应。
details.example: His reaction to the news was one of shock.

name: on the rocks
chn: （关系）陷于困境, 濒临崩溃
example_en: Their marriage has been on the rocks for months.
example_cn: 他们的婚姻好几个月来都岌岌可危。
memory_tips: 想象一杯加冰的威士忌叫 'whiskey on the rocks'。现在想象一段关系像冰块一样冷，并且布满了“岩石”（困难），即将触礁沉没。
collocations: marriage on the rocks, relationship on the rocks, business is on the rocks
image_prompt: 一对夫妻坐在沙发的两端，背对背，表情冷漠，他们之间有一道象征性的裂缝，背景昏暗，暗示着他们陷入困境的关系。

name: awkward
chn: adj. 笨拙的; 令人尴尬的; 难对付的
example_en: There was an awkward silence after he told the bad joke.
example_cn: 他讲完那个蹩脚的笑话后，现场一片尴尬的沉默。
word_family: awkwardly (adv. 笨拙地; 尴尬地), awkwardness (n. 笨拙; 尴尬)
memory_tips: 发音联想：'awk'听起来像'哦！'，'ward'朝向。当你朝着一个错误的方向走去时，你会发出'哦！'的惊叹，感觉很'awkward'（尴尬）。
collocations: awkward silence, awkward situation, feel awkward, socially awkward
image_prompt: 一群人在一个派对上站成一圈，但没有人说话，大家都尴尬地看着地面或手机，气氛非常不自在。

synonym_diff.quick_guide: 形容动作笨拙用 clumsy，形容场面或感觉尴尬用 awkward/embarrassing。

details.focus: 指身体动作不协调、笨手笨脚
details.example: He is very clumsy and often drops things.

details.focus: 指某事让你感到羞愧或难为情
details.example: It was embarrassing when I forgot her name.

details.focus: 指社交上不舒服、不自然或难处理的局面，也可以指动作笨拙
details.example: An awkward pause in the conversation.

name: sight
chn: n. 视野; 视力; 看见
example_en: The view from the mountaintop was a beautiful sight.
example_cn: 从山顶看到的景色非常壮观。
word_family: see (v. 看见), vision (n. 视力; 想象力), visible (adj. 可见的)
memory_tips: 和 light (光) 关联记忆，有光(light)才能看见(sight)。
collocations: at first sight (乍一看), lose sight of (看不见), catch sight of (瞥见)
image_prompt: 一个人站在山顶，张开双臂，俯瞰着下方广阔的日出景色，云海翻腾，光芒万丈。

name: out of one's sight
chn: 脱离某人的视线
example_en: The ship sailed away and was soon out of our sight.
example_cn: 船驶离了，很快就消失在我们的视线之外。
memory_tips: 字面意思：'out of' (在...之外) + 'one's sight' (某人的视线)。
collocations: go out of sight, keep out of sight
image_prompt: 在码头上，几个人挥手告别，一艘大船正向着海平线远去，船身越来越小，即将消失。

name: original
chn: adj. 起初的; 独创的; 原作的
example_en: You should read the original novel, not the movie adaptation.
example_cn: 你应该读原著小说，而不是看改编的电影。
word_family: originally (adv. 最初; 起初), origin (n. 起源; 由来), originality (n. 独创性), originate (v. 起源于)
memory_tips: 来自'origin'(起源)，所以'original'就是最'起源'的，也就是'最初的，原作的'。
collocations: original idea, original plan, original version, original copy
image_prompt: 桌子上并排摆放着一本厚厚的旧书和一张电影海报，海报内容明显改编自这本书。

name: medium
chn: n. (pl. media) 传播信息的媒介, 方法; 手段, 工具 adj. 中等的, 中号的
example_en: The internet is a powerful medium for communication.
example_cn: 互联网是一种强大的交流媒介。
word_family: media (n. 媒体), median (n. 中位数)
memory_tips: 词根 'medi-' 意为'中间'。作为媒介，它在两者'中间'传递信息；作为形容词，它表示大小'中等'。
collocations: a medium of instruction, a happy medium (折中办法), medium size
image_prompt: 一个地球仪被无数发光的线条连接，这些线条汇集到一台笔记本电脑上，象征着互联网作为全球沟通的媒介。

name: social media
chn: 社交媒体
example_en: He spends too much time on social media.
example_cn: 他在社交媒体上花了太多时间。
memory_tips: 由 'social' (社交的) 和 'media' (媒体) 组成，即用于社交的媒体平台。
collocations: post on social media, browse social media, social media platform
image_prompt: 一个人躺在床上，在黑暗中只有手机屏幕发光，屏幕上显示着各种社交媒体应用的图标。

name: make it
chn: 能够出席; 准时到达; 获得成功
example_en: Despite the heavy traffic, he managed to make it to the meeting on time.
example_cn: 尽管交通拥堵，他还是设法准时赶到了会议现场。
memory_tips: 可以理解为“做到了！”。语境可以是“赶到了”、“成功了”或“办到了”。
collocations: make it on time, make it to the top (登上顶峰), sorry I can't make it
image_prompt: 一个人冲进会议室，一边擦汗一边看手表，会议室里其他人已经就座，他露出了庆幸的表情。

name: horrible
chn: adj. 令人震惊的; 可恶的, 极坏的
example_en: The weather was horrible all week, with constant rain and wind.
example_cn: 整个星期的天气都很糟糕，不停地下雨刮风。
word_family: horror (n. 震惊; 恐惧), horribly (adv. 可怕地, 恐怖地), horrify (v. 使恐惧)
memory_tips: 来自'horror'(恐怖)，所以'horrible'就是'像恐怖片一样'的，即'可怕的，极坏的'。
collocations: horrible weather, horrible smell, a horrible day
image_prompt: 窗外狂风暴雨，树木被吹得东倒西歪，天空乌云密布，一个人在室内无奈地看着窗外。

synonym_diff.quick_guide: 这几个词在口语中常互换，都表示“非常糟糕”。horrible 侧重于引起反感或恐惧。

details.focus: 最常用的词，形容质量、情况或感觉极差
details.example: I feel terrible about what happened.

details.focus: 强调引起恐惧或忧虑，比 terrible/awful 更正式
details.example: The news reported a dreadful accident.

details.focus: 强调令人憎恶、反感或恐惧
details.example: There was a horrible mess in the kitchen.

name: chat
chn: vi. & n. 聊天, 闲聊
example_en: They would often chat for hours on the phone.
example_cn: 他们过去常常在电话里一聊就是几个小时。
word_family: chatty (adj. 爱闲聊的), chatbot (n. 聊天机器人)
memory_tips: 发音像“切特”，朋友间没什么正事，“切”点“特”产八卦，就是聊天。
collocations: have a chat, chat with someone, online chat
image_prompt: 一个年轻人舒适地坐在椅子上，愉快地打着电话，脸上带着微笑，看起来非常放松。

name: café
chn: n. 咖啡馆, 小餐馆
example_en: Let's meet at the café on the corner for a coffee.
example_cn: 我们去街角的咖啡馆喝杯咖啡吧。
word_family: coffee (n. 咖啡), caffeine (n. 咖啡因)
memory_tips: 直接来自法语，意为'咖啡'，后来指卖咖啡的地方。注意重音在后，发音像“开-费”。
collocations: internet café (网吧), local café, sit in a café
image_prompt: 一个温馨的街角咖啡馆，有户外座位，几个人在悠闲地喝着咖啡聊天，阳光明媚。

name: recover
chn: vi. 恢复健康; 恢复常态 vt. 全额收回; 寻回; 重新获得
example_en: It took her a long time to recover from the flu.
example_cn: 她花了很长时间才从流感中恢复过来。
word_family: recovery (n. 康复, 恢复)
memory_tips: 拆分记忆：'re-' (重新) + 'cover' (覆盖)。可以想象生病时身体被病毒“覆盖”，'recover' 就是把健康“重新覆盖”回来。
collocations: recover from an illness, recover lost data, recover costs
image_prompt: 一个病人从病床上坐起来，微笑着看着窗外的阳光，护士在一旁欣慰地看着她，象征着健康的恢复。

name: respond
chn: vi. & vt. 回答, 回应; 作出反应, 响应
example_en: He didn't respond to my question.
example_cn: 他没有回答我的问题。
word_family: response (n. 回答; 反应), respondent (n. 回答者; 被告), responsive (adj. 反应灵敏的)
memory_tips: 联想 'responsible' (有责任的)。一个有责任心的人，别人问话或求助时，会及时'respond'（回应）。
collocations: respond to an email, respond to treatment (对治疗有反应), respond quickly
image_prompt: 一个人在会议上举手提问，而被提问的人却转过头看着别处，没有做出任何回应。

synonym_diff.quick_guide: 三者常可互换。answer 最普通，直接回答问题。reply 稍正式，可回复信件等。respond 范围最广，可以是语言或行动上的任何反应。

details.focus: 直接针对一个问题给出信息
details.example: Please answer the question.

details.focus: 对别人的言论、信件、邮件等进行回复，比 answer 正式
details.example: I'm writing to reply to your inquiry.

details.focus: 更广泛的“反应”，可以是口头、书面或行动上的
details.example: The patient did not respond to the medicine.

name: loss
chn: n. 失去, 丧失; 亏损; 去世; 损失
example_en: The company suffered a huge financial loss last year.
example_cn: 这家公司去年遭受了巨大的财务亏损。
word_family: lose (v. 失去), lost (adj. 迷路的; 丢失的)
memory_tips: 是动词'lose'的名词形式。发音和'boss'押韵，可以记'boss'承担公司的'loss'（亏损）。
collocations: a financial loss, hearing loss (听力损失), weight loss (减肥), loss of memory (失忆)
image_prompt: 一张显示下降趋势的财务报表图，旁边一个商人表情沮丧地捂着头。

name: at a loss
chn: 不知所措, 困惑
example_en: When I saw the complex math problem, I was at a loss.
example_cn: 当我看到那道复杂的数学题时，我感到不知所措。
memory_tips: 处于一种'loss'（迷失）的状态，不知道方向，所以“不知所措”。
collocations: be at a loss for words (无言以对), be at a loss what to do
image_prompt: 一个学生站在一块写满了复杂公式的黑板前，抓着头发，脸上充满困惑和迷茫的表情。

name: judge
chn: vt. & vi. 评价,（尤指）批评; 判断, 认为 n. 法官; 裁判员
example_en: You shouldn't judge a book by its cover.
example_cn: 你不应该以貌取人（书）。
word_family: judgement/judgment (n. 判断力; 意见, 看法), judicious (adj. 明智的, 有判断力的)
memory_tips: 发音像'夹具'，法官（judge）用法律的'夹具'来判断是非。或者联想法官 Judge Dredd。
collocations: judge by appearance, judge a competition, a good judge of character
image_prompt: 一个人站在书架前，手里拿着一本封面朴素的书，却看得津津有味，而旁边其他封面华丽的书则无人问津。

synonym_diff.quick_guide: 主观看法用 judge，专业评估用 evaluate/assess，评级打分用 rate，粗略估算用 estimate。

details.focus: 系统性地评估价值或质量（如项目、员工表现）
details.example: The committee will evaluate the applications.

details.focus: 评定（价值、数额、重要性）以作决策（如风险、损失）
details.example: They need to assess the impact on the environment.

details.focus: 评价等级或水平（如电影、酒店）
details.example: I'd rate this restaurant five stars.

details.focus: （根据不完全信息）估算成本、数量或大小
details.example: Can you estimate the cost of the repair?

name: in the wrong
chn: 有错, 应承担责任
example_en: He finally admitted that he was in the wrong.
example_cn: 他最终承认是自己错了。
memory_tips: 字面意思：处于'wrong'（错误）的状态中，所以是“有错”。
collocations: be in the wrong, admit being in the wrong
image_prompt: 两个人正在争论，其中一个人低下头，举起手，做出一个承认错误、表示歉意的姿态。

name: apologize
chn: vi. 道歉, 谢罪
example_en: You should apologize to her for being so rude.
example_cn: 你应该为你的粗鲁向她道歉。
word_family: apology (n. 道歉, 歉意), apologetic (adj. 道歉的, 愧疚的)
memory_tips: 名词是 'apology'。可以想象一个人'a polo'（穿着Polo衫）很真诚地在'apologize'（道歉）。
collocations: apologize for something, apologize to someone, sincerely apologize
image_prompt: 一个人向另一个人递上一束花，表情真诚，身体微微鞠躬，表示歉意。

name: behaviour
chn: n. (AmE behavior) 行为, 举止, 态度
example_en: His behaviour at the party was unacceptable.
example_cn: 他在派对上的行为是不可接受的。
word_family: behave (v. 表现; 举止得体), well-behaved (adj. 行为端正的)
memory_tips: 是动词 'behave' 的名词形式。'be' (是) + 'have' (有)，你'是'什么样，'有'什么样的表现，就是你的'behaviour'（行为）。
collocations: good behaviour, bad behaviour, human behaviour, animal behaviour
image_prompt: 在一次正式晚宴上，一个人穿着得体，举止优雅，而另一个人则在大声喧哗，将脚翘在桌子上，形成鲜明对比。

synonym_diff.quick_guide: 日常举止用 behaviour，特定场合或道德层面的行为用 conduct，社交礼仪用 manner(s)。

details.focus: 更正式，常指在特定环境或道德标准下的行为方式（如职业操守）
details.example: The report criticized the doctor's professional conduct.

details.focus: 通常用复数，指社交礼仪、风度、习惯
details.example: He has very good manners.

details.focus: 最通用的词，指人或动物的任何行为举止
details.example: The child's bad behaviour was a problem.

name: case
chn: n. 具体情况, 事例; 案件; 容器
example_en: In case of emergency, please call this number.
example_cn: 如遇紧急情况，请拨打此号码。
memory_tips: 一词多义。'case' 可以是装东西的“箱子”，也可以是法律上的“案件”，还可以是某种“情况”。用“一个箱子里装着一个棘手的案件情况”来打包记忆。
collocations: in case of (以防), a court case (法庭案件), a classic case (典型事例), a pencil case (铅笔盒)
image_prompt: 一个红色的紧急按钮在一个玻璃罩（case）下，旁边有一个牌子写着 “In case of emergency, break glass”。

name: in any case
chn: 无论如何, 不管怎样
example_en: It might rain, but in any case, I'm still going for a walk.
example_cn: 可能会下雨，但无论如何，我还是要出去散步。
memory_tips: 字面意思：在'any'（任何）'case'（情况）下。所以就是“无论如何”。
collocations: in any case, it's a good idea to...
image_prompt: 一个人穿着雨衣，打着伞，坚定地在小雨中散步，脸上带着微笑，背景是阴沉的天空。

name: frank
chn: adj. 坦率的, 直率的
example_en: To be frank, I don't think your plan will work.
example_cn: 坦白说，我认为你的计划行不通。
word_family: frankly (adv. 坦率地, 老实说)
memory_tips: 联想人名 Frank。想象一个叫 Frank 的朋友，他说话总是很直接，非常'frank'（坦率）。
collocations: be frank with someone, a frank discussion, to be frank
image_prompt: 两个人坐在桌子两边，一个人摊开双手，表情严肃而真诚地向另一个人解释着什么，氛围坦诚。

name: definitely
chn: adv. 肯定, 确实; 确切地
example_en: I will definitely be at the party tomorrow.
example_cn: 我明天肯定会去参加派对。
word_family: definite (adj. 明确的, 肯定的), definition (n. 定义)
memory_tips: 来自'definite'(明确的)。事情是'definite'的，那么你做这件事的态度就是'definitely'（肯定地）。
collocations: most definitely, definitely not, will definitely...
image_prompt: 日历上，明天的日期被一个大大的红色圆圈圈起来，旁边写着“Party!”和三个感叹号，表示一种确定的计划。

name: trick
chn: vt. 欺骗, 欺诈 n. 诡计, 花招; 戏法
example_en: The magician performed an amazing card trick.
example_cn: 魔术师表演了一个精彩的纸牌戏法。
word_family: tricky (adj. 棘手的; 狡猾的)
memory_tips: 发音像“吹客”，骗子'trick'（欺骗）别人时，就靠“吹”。万圣节的 'trick or treat' (不给糖就捣蛋) 也能帮助记忆。
collocations: play a trick on someone (捉弄某人), a magic trick (魔术), a dirty trick (卑鄙的伎俩)
image_prompt: 一个魔术师在舞台上，手里拿着一副扑克牌，他正向观众展示一张牌，脸上带着神秘的微笑。

name: let go of
chn: 放弃, 摒弃; 松手, 放开
example_en: You need to let go of your past mistakes and move on.
example_cn: 你需要放下过去的错误，继续前进。
memory_tips: 字面意思：让(let)它走(go)。既可以指物理上的“松手”，也可以指情感上的“放下”。
collocations: let go of the rope, let go of anger, let go of the past
image_prompt: 一个人的手正松开一个沉重的、刻着“Past”字的石头，让它掉下悬崖，面朝着远方的日出。

name: ignore
chn: vt. 忽视, 对…不予理会
